episodeTitle: A Samurai Who Can Cut Fire! Foxfire Kin'emon!
episodeTitleJapanese: 炎切り裂く侍！狐火の錦えもん！
episodeTitleRomanized: Honoo Kirisaku Samurai! Kitsunebi no Kin'emon!
description: Vergo brutally crushes Law's heart, leaving the Warlord helpless. Meanwhile, Sanji dives into the lake to rescue Kin'emon's torso from a shark. With his body finally reunited, the mysterious samurai reveals his identity and demonstrates his incredible Foxfire Style, cutting through fire and explosions to save the group from the deadly slime.

events.title: Vergo Crushes Law's Heart
events.description: Vergo appears from the shadows and stops Law in his tracks by literally squeezing his disembodied heart. Law had previously given his heart to Caesar as part of their agreement, and Caesar gave it to Vergo. Vergo uses the heart to brutally incapacitate Law, demonstrating his mastery of Armament Haki by imbuing his bamboo stick with it.
events.significance: Reveals the extent of Caesar's manipulation of Law and establishes Vergo as a formidable threat. This moment shows Law at his most vulnerable and demonstrates how his Devil Fruit ability can be used against him when his heart is literally in enemy hands.

quotes.text: Law, you should know better than to betray Caesar when he holds your heart.
quotes.speaker: Vergo
quotes.context: Vergo threatens Law while squeezing his heart

events.title: Vergo's Haki-Imbued Attack on Law
events.description: Vergo brutally beats Law to the ground using a bamboo stick imbued with Armament Haki. Law is completely helpless because Vergo can immobilize him at any moment by squeezing his heart. This demonstrates Vergo's mastery of Haki and his ruthless combat style.
events.significance: Establishes Vergo as one of the most dangerous opponents in the Punk Hazard arc. Shows that even a powerful Warlord like Law can be defeated when his heart is literally held by the enemy. This scene sets up the later confrontation where Law must retrieve his heart to stand a chance.

events.title: Caesar Orders Captives Restrained
events.description: Caesar Clown orders that the captured Straw Hat Pirates and G-5 Marines be properly restrained, demonstrating his control over the situation. He gloats about his victory and plans to use them as test subjects for his experiments.
events.significance: Shows Caesar's sadistic nature and sets up the stakes for the rescue mission. The Straw Hats and their allies are in grave danger as Caesar plans to experiment on them.

quotes.text: Make sure they're all properly restrained. I have special plans for these intruders.
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar orders his subordinates to secure the captured pirates and marines

events.title: Chopper Investigates Caesar's Lab
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper continues his investigation of Caesar's laboratory, searching for clues about the experiments being conducted on the children. He discovers more evidence of Caesar's cruel and inhumane treatment of the kidnapped children.
events.significance: Reinforces Chopper's determination to save the children and exposes more of Caesar's heinous crimes. This investigation adds to the moral weight of the Straw Hats' mission on Punk Hazard.

events.title: Sanji Decides to Rescue Kin'emon's Torso
events.description: After locating Kin'emon's torso in the poisoned lake using his observation, Sanji makes the dangerous decision to dive into the toxic water to rescue it. The group realizes the torso is underwater because Kin'emon's Devil Fruit ability prevents him from swimming, and the torso has been describing the sensation of being submerged.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's heroism and quick thinking. Shows the collaborative effort to reunite the mysterious samurai, setting up the revelation of his identity and powers.

quotes.text: I'll get that torso before the poison covers the entire lake!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji volunteers to dive into the dangerous lake

events.title: Sanji Fights Shark to Save Kin'emon's Torso
events.description: While diving in the poisoned lake, Sanji encounters a shark attempting to eat Kin'emon's torso. Using his Joue Shoot technique, Sanji kicks the shark away and grabs the torso, then swims back to the surface before the poison completely covers the lake.
events.significance: Showcases Sanji's combat prowess underwater and his determination to save others even in dangerous conditions. The successful rescue allows Kin'emon to be reunited.

events.title: Kin'emon's Body Fully Reunited
events.description: Sanji successfully returns with Kin'emon's torso, and the three separated body parts (head, legs, and torso) are finally reunited. The mysterious samurai is now whole for the first time since the Straw Hats encountered him on Punk Hazard.
events.significance: Completes the mystery of the separated samurai that has been building since earlier episodes. With his body whole, Kin'emon can now reveal his true identity and demonstrate his full abilities.

quotes.text: At last! I am whole again! I am deeply grateful for your assistance!
quotes.speaker: Kin'emon
quotes.context: Kin'emon expresses gratitude after being reunited

events.title: Kin'emon Reveals His Identity
events.description: With his body fully reunited, the mysterious samurai formally introduces himself as Kin'emon of Foxfire, a samurai from the Land of Wano. This is the first time his full name and title are revealed to the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Formally introduces one of the most important allies the Straw Hats will have in their journey. Kin'emon becomes a key character in multiple arcs leading all the way to Wano Country. This marks the beginning of the Wano storyline that will become central to the series.

quotes.text: I am Kin'emon of Foxfire, a samurai from the Land of Wano!
quotes.speaker: Kin'emon

events.title: Kin'emon Demonstrates Foxfire Style
events.description: Surrounded by Caesar's deadly slime creatures, Kin'emon demonstrates his signature Foxfire Style for the first time. He ignites his sword, setting the slime on fire, causing it to explode. Then, in a spectacular display, he cuts through the explosion itself, dissipating the flames and saving everyone from the blast.
events.significance: Debuts one of the most unique sword techniques in One Piece - the ability to cut fire itself. This technique becomes significant later when Zoro learns from it. The Foxfire Style showcases the advanced swordsmanship techniques from Wano Country.

quotes.text: Behold! The Foxfire Style! I can both create flame and sever it!
quotes.speaker: Kin'emon
quotes.context: Kin'emon explains his technique while demonstrating it

events.title: Kin'emon Reveals His Son Momonosuke
events.description: Kin'emon reveals that he has come to Punk Hazard to rescue his son, Momonosuke, who was kidnapped and brought to the island. He declares his determination to find and save his child no matter what dangers lie ahead.
events.significance: Introduces Momonosuke, who becomes one of the most important characters in the series. Establishes Kin'emon's motivation and the emotional stakes of his mission. This revelation ties into the larger Wano Country storyline.

quotes.text: My son, Momonosuke, was taken to this accursed island. I must find him and bring him home!
quotes.speaker: Kin'emon
quotes.context: Kin'emon reveals his mission to rescue his son

events.title: Zoro Offers to Help Rescue Momonosuke
events.description: Impressed by Kin'emon's Foxfire Style and moved by his mission to rescue his son, Zoro immediately volunteers to help. He expresses particular interest in Kin'emon's sword technique and the swordsmanship of Wano Country.
events.significance: Establishes the alliance between the Straw Hats and Kin'emon that will last through multiple arcs. Shows Zoro's interest in learning advanced sword techniques, which pays off later when he develops similar fire-cutting abilities.

quotes.text: That technique... I want to see more of it. We'll help you find your son.
quotes.speaker: Zoro

events.title: First Mention of the Land of Wano
events.description: Through Kin'emon's introduction, the Land of Wano is mentioned as a distinct location separate from the World Government's reach. This mysterious isolated country is described as the home of powerful samurai.
events.significance: Plants the seeds for the Wano Country arc, which becomes one of the longest and most important arcs in One Piece. Introduces the concept of samurai and their unique fighting styles to the series.

quotes.context: Kin'emon's formal introduction after being reunited

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the lengths a father will go to rescue his child, as Kin'emon's entire mission revolves around finding Momonosuke. This theme of familial bonds drives the narrative.
themes.symbolism: Kin'emon's separated body parts coming together mirrors his determination to reunite with his son.

themes.description: Vergo's control over Law through his literal heart demonstrates the dangers of making deals with untrustworthy parties. Caesar's manipulation and Law's vulnerability show how power can be used for control.
themes.symbolism: The physical heart being held represents emotional and tactical vulnerability.

themes.description: The Straw Hats' immediate decision to help Kin'emon rescue his son shows their compassion and willingness to help those in need, even strangers.
themes.symbolism: The act of reuniting Kin'emon's body symbolizes the coming together of allies.

characterSpotlights.development: Kin'emon is finally fully revealed after episodes of mystery. His identity as a samurai from Wano, his Foxfire Style technique, and his mission to rescue Momonosuke are all established.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several scenes, particularly Sanji's underwater rescue sequence with additional shots of the shark and the poisoned lake.
Some dialogue was expanded in the anime to better explain Kin'emon's Foxfire Style technique for viewers.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first full appearance of Kin'emon with his body completely intact. He had been separated into parts since his introduction.
The Foxfire Style demonstrated by Kin'emon later inspires Zoro's development of his own fire-cutting abilities in the Wano arc.
This is the first time the Land of Wano is explicitly mentioned by name and described as a closed-off country of samurai.
The episode aired on June 2, 2013, in Japan and adapts Chapter 672 'My Name is Kin'emon!!' from the manga.
Kenyu Horiuchi, who voices Kin'emon in Japanese, is known for voicing dignified and serious characters, making him perfect for the samurai role.
